spells.name: Acid Arrow
spells.description: You conjure a corrosive bolt that hits one foe, dealing 1d6 damage a round. The bolt remains in the target for as long as you focus.

spells.name: Alarm
spells.description: You touch one object, such as a door threshold, setting a magical alarm on it. If any creature you do not designate while casting the spell touches or crosses past the object, a magical bell sounds in your head.

spells.name: Alter Self
spells.description: You magically change your physical form, gaining one feature that modifies your existing anatomy. For example, you can grow functional gills on your neck or bear claws on your fingers. This spell can’t grow wings or limbs.

spells.name: Animate Dead
spells.description: You touch one humanoid’s remains, and it rises as a zombie or skeleton under your control. The remains must have at least three limbs and its head intact. The undead creature acts on your turn. After 1 day, the creature collapses into grave dust.

spells.name: Antimagic Shell
spells.description: An invisible, near-sized cube of null-magic appears centered on you. Within the cube, no spells can be cast. Magic items and spells have no effect in the zone, and no magic can enter. The cube moves with you. Spells such as dispel magic have no effect on it. Another antimagic shell does not affect this one.

spells.name: Arcane Eye
spells.description: You conjure an invisible, grape-sized eye within range. You can see through the eye. It can see in the dark out to near range, fly near on your turn, and squeeze through openings as narrow as a keyhole.

spells.name: Augury
spells.description: You interpret the meaning of supernatural portents and omens. Ask the GM one question about a specific course of action. The GM says whether the action will lead to “weal” or “woe.”

spells.name: Bless
spells.description: One creature you touch gains a luck token.

spells.name: Blind-Deafen
spells.description: You utter a divine censure, blinding or deafening one creature you can see in range. The creature has disadvantage on tasks requiring the lost sense.

spells.name: Burning Hands
spells.description: You spread your fingers with thumbs touching, unleashing a circle of flame that roars out to a close area around where you stand. Creatures within the area of effect take 1d6 damage, and flammable objects catch fire.

spells.name: Charm Person
spells.description: You magically beguile one humanoid of level 2 or less within near range, who regards you as a friend for the duration. The spell ends if you or your allies do anything to hurt it that it notices. The target knows you magically enchanted it after the spell ends.

spells.name: Cleansing Weapon
spells.description: One weapon you touch is wreathed in purifying flames. It deals an additional 1d4 damage (1d6 vs. undead) for the duration.

spells.name: Cloudkill
spells.description: A putrid cloud of yellow poison fills a near-sized cube within range. It spreads around corners. Creatures inside the cloud are blinded and take 2d6 damage at the beginning of their turns. A creature of LV 9 or less that ends its turn fully inside the cloud dies.

spells.name: Command
spells.description: You issue a verbal command to one creature in range who can understand you. The command must be one word, such as “kneel.” The target obeys the command for as long as you focus. If your command is ever directly harmful to the creature, it may make a Charisma check vs. your last spellcasting check. On a success, the spell ends.

spells.name: Commune
spells.description: You seek your god's counsel. Ask the GM up to three yes or no questions. The GM truthfully answers "yes" or "no" to each. If you cast this spell more than once in 24 hours, treat a failed spellcasting check for it as a critical failure instead.

spells.name: Confusion
spells.description: You mesmerize one creature you can see in range. The target can't take actions, and it moves in a random direction on its turn. If the target is LV 9+, it may make a WIS check vs. your last spellcasting check at the start of its turn to end the spell.

spells.name: Control Water
spells.description: You move and shape water. You can cause a section of water up to 100 feet in width and depth to change shape, defy gravity, or flow in a different direction.

spells.name: Create Undead
spells.description: You conjure a vengeful undead creature to do your bidding. When you cast this spell, you choose to summon either a wight or wraith. It appears next to you and is under your control. The undead creature acts on your turn. After 1 day, it melts away into smoke.

spells.name: Cure Wounds
spells.description: Your touch restores ebbing life. Roll a number of d6s equal to 1 + half your level (rounded down). One target you touch regains that many hit points.

spells.name: Detect Magic
spells.description: You can sense the presence of magic within near range for the spell's duration. If you focus for two rounds, you discern its general properties. Full barriers block this spell.

spells.name: Detect Thoughts
spells.description: You peer into the mind of one creature you can see within range. Each round, you learn the target’s immediate thoughts. On its turn, the target makes a Wisdom check vs. your last spellcasting check. If the target succeeds, it notices your presence in its mind and the spell ends.

spells.name: Dimension Door
spells.description: You teleport yourself and up to one other willing creature within close to any point you can see.

spells.name: Disintegrate
spells.description: A green ray shoots from your finger and turns a creature or object into ash. A target creature of LV 5 or less instantly dies. If it is LV 6+, it takes 3d8 damage instead. A non-magical object up to the size of a large tree is destroyed.

spells.name: Dispel Magic
spells.description: End one spell that affects one target you can see in range.

spells.name: Divination
spells.description: You throw the divining bones or peer into the blackness between the stars, seeking a portent. You can ask the GM one yes or no question. The GM truthfully answers "yes" or "no." If you cast this spell more than once in 24 hours, treat a failed spellcasting check for it as a critical failure instead.

spells.name: Divine Vengeance
spells.description: You become the divine avatar of your god's wrath, wreathed in holy flames or a black aura of smoldering corruption. For the spell's duration, you can fly a near distance, your weapons are magical, and you have a +4 bonus to your weapon attacks and damage.

spells.name: Dominion
spells.description: Mighty beings come to your aid. The beings must have a combined total of 16 levels or less. Chaotic PCs summon demons/devils, and lawful or neutral PCs summon angels. The beings act of free will to aid you on your turn. After 10 rounds, they return to their realms. You cannot cast this spell again until you complete penance.

spells.name: Fabricate
spells.description: This spell can't target creatures. You turn a tree-sized collection of raw materials into a finished work. For example, you convert a pile of bricks or rocks into a bridge. The finished work converts back to raw materials when the spell ends.

spells.name: Feather Fall
spells.description: You may make an attempt to cast this spell when you fall. Your rate of descent slows so that you land safely on your feet.

spells.name: Fireball
spells.description: You hurl a small flame that erupts into a fiery blast. All creatures in a near-sized cube around where the flame lands take 4d6 damage.

spells.name: Fixed Object
spells.description: An object you touch that weighs no more than 5 pounds becomes fixed in its current location. It can support up to 5,000 pounds of weight for the duration of the spell.

spells.name: Flame Strike
spells.description: You call down a holy pillar of fire, immolating one creature you can see within range. The target takes 2d6 damage.

spells.name: Floating Disk
spells.description: You create a floating, circular disk of force with a concave center. It can carry up to 20 gear slots. It hovers at waist level and automatically stays within near of you. It can’t cross over drop- offs or pits taller than a human.

spells.name: Fly
spells.description: Your feet lift from the ground, and you take to the air like a hummingbird. You can fly near for the spell's duration and are able to hover in place.

spells.name: Gaseous Form
spells.description: You and your gear turn into a cloud of smoke for the spell's duration. You can fly and pass through any gap that smoke could. You can sense the terrain and any movement around you out to a near distance. You can't cast spells while in this form.

spells.name: Heal
spells.description: One creature you touch is healed to full hit points. You cannot cast this spell again until you complete a rest.

spells.name: Hold Monster
spells.description: You paralyze one creature you can see within range. If the target is LV 9+, it may make a STR check vs. your last spellcasting check at the start of its turn to end the spell.

spells.name: Hold Person
spells.description: You magically paralyze one humanoid creature of LV 4 or less you can see within range.

spells.name: Hold Portal
spells.description: You magically hold a portal closed for the duration. A creature must make a successful STR check vs. your spellcasting check to open the portal. The knock spell ends this spell.

spells.name: Holy Weapon
spells.description: One weapon you touch is imbued with a sacred blessing. The weapon becomes magical and has +1 to attack and damage rolls for the duration.

spells.name: Illusion
spells.description: You create a convincing visible and audible illusion that fills up to a near-sized cube in range. The illusion cannot cause harm, but creatures who believe the illusion is real react to it as though it were. A creature who inspects the illusion from afar must pass a Wisdom check vs. your last spellcasting check to perceive the false nature of the illusion. Touching the illusion also reveals its false nature.

spells.name: Invisibility
spells.description: A creature you touch becomes invisible for the spell’s duration. The spell ends if the target attacks or casts a spell.

spells.name: Judgment
spells.description: You instantly banish a creature you touch, sending it and all possessions it carries to face the judgment of your god. You can banish an intelligent creature of LV 10 or less. When the creature returns in 5 rounds, it has been healed to full hit points if its deeds pleased your god. It has been reduced to 1 hit point if its deeds angered your god. If your god can't judge its actions, it is unchanged.

spells.name: Knock
spells.description: A door, window, gate, chest, or portal you can see within range instantly opens, defeating all mundane locks and barriers. This spell creates a loud knock audible to all within earshot.

spells.name: Lay To Rest
spells.description: You instantly send an undead creature you touch to its final afterlife, destroying it utterly. You can target an undead creature of LV 9 or less.

spells.name: Levitate
spells.description: You can float a near distance vertically per round on your turn. You can also push against solid objects to move horizontally.

spells.name: Light
spells.description: One object you touch glows with bright, heatless light, illuminating out to a near distance for 1 hour of real time.

spells.name: Lightning Bolt
spells.description: You shoot a blue-white ray of lightning from your hands, hitting all creatures in a straight line out to a far distance. Creatures struck by the lightning take 3d6 damage.

spells.name: Mage Armor
spells.description: An invisible layer of magical force protects your vitals. Your armor class becomes 14 (18 on a critical spellcasting check) for the spell’s duration.

spells.name: Magic Circle
spells.description: You conjure a circle of runes out to near-sized cube centered on yourself and name a type of creature (for example, demons). For the spell’s duration, creatures of the chosen type cannot attack or cast a hostile spell on anyone inside the circle. The chosen creatures also can’t possess, compel, or beguile anyone inside the circle.

spells.name: Magic Missile
spells.description: You have advantage on your check to cast this spell. A glowing bolt of force streaks from your open hand, dealing 1d4 damage to one target.

spells.name: Mass Cure
spells.description: All allies within near range of you regain 2d6 hit points.

spells.name: Mirror Image
spells.description: You create a number of illusory duplicates of yourself equal to half your level rounded down (minimum 1). The duplicates surround you and mimic you. Each time a creature attacks you, the attack misses and causes one of the duplicates to evaporate. If all of the illusions have disappeared, the spell ends.

spells.name: Misty Step
spells.description: In a puff of smoke, you teleport a near distance to an area you can see.

spells.name: Passwall
spells.description: A tunnel of your height opens in a barrier you touch and lasts for the duration. The passage can be up to near distance in length and must be in a straight line.

spells.name: Pillar of Salt
spells.description: A creature you target turns into a statue made of hardened salt. You can target a creature you can see of LV 5 or less. If you successfully focus on this spell for 3 rounds in a row, the transformation becomes permanent.

spells.name: Plane Shift
spells.description: You fold space and time, transporting yourself and all willing creatures within close range to a location on another plane of your choice. Unless you have been to your intended location before, you appear in a random place on the destination plane.

spells.name: Polymorph
spells.description: You transform a creature you touch into another natural creature you choose of equal or smaller size. Any gear the target carries melds into its new form. The target gains the creature's physical stats and features, but it retains its non-physical stats and features. If the target goes to 0 hit points, it reverts to its true form at half its prior hit points. You can target any willing creature with this spell, or an unwilling creature whose level is less than or equal to half your level rounded down (min. 1).

spells.name: Power Word Kill
spells.description: You utter the Word of Doom. One creature you target of LV 9 or less dies if it hears you. Treat a failed spellcasting check for this spell as a critical failure, and roll the mishap with disadvantage.

spells.name: Prismatic Orb
spells.description: You send a strobing orb of energy streaking toward a target within range. Choose an energy type from fire, cold, or electricity. The orb deals 3d8 damage and delivers a concussive blast of the chosen energy type. If the energy type is anathema to the target's existence (for example, cold energy against a fire elemental), the orb deals double damage to it instead.

spells.name: Prophecy
spells.description: You commune directly with your god for guidance. Ask the GM one question. The GM answers the question truthfully using the knowledge your god possesses. Deities are mighty, but not omniscient. You cannot cast this spell again until you complete penance.

spells.name: Protection From Energy
spells.description: One creature you touch becomes impervious to the wild fury of the elements. Choose fire, cold, or electricity. For the spell's duration, the target is immune to harm from energy of the chosen type.

spells.name: Protection From Evil
spells.description: For the spell’s duration, chaotic beings have disadvantage on attack rolls and hostile spellcasting checks against the target. These beings also can’t possess, compel, or beguile it. When cast on an already- possessed target, the possessing entity makes a CHA check vs. the last spellcasting check. On a failure, the entity is expelled.

spells.name: Rebuke Unholy
spells.description: You rebuke creatures who oppose your alignment, forcing them to flee. You must present a holy symbol to cast this spell. If you are lawful or neutral, this spell affects demons, devils, and outsiders. If you are chaotic, this spell affects angels and natural creatures of the wild. Affected creatures within near of you must make a CHA check vs. your spellcasting check. If a creature fails by 10+ points and is equal to or less than your level, it is destroyed. Otherwise, on a fail, it flees from you for 5 rounds.

spells.name: Regenerate
spells.description: A creature you touch regains 1d4 hit points on your turn for the duration. This spell also regrows lost body parts.

spells.name: Resilient Sphere
spells.description: You conjure a weightless, glassy sphere around you that extends out to close range. For the spell's duration, nothing can pass through or crush the sphere. You can roll the sphere a near distance on your turn.

spells.name: Restoration
spells.description: With the touch of your hands, you expunge curses and illnesses. One curse, illness, or affliction of your choice affecting the target creature ends.

spells.name: Scrying
spells.description: You look into a crystal ball or reflecting pool, calling up images of a distant place. For the spell's duration, you can see and hear a creature or location you choose that is on the same plane. This spell is DC 18 to cast if you try to scry on a creature or location that is unfamiliar to you. Each round, creatures you view may make a Wisdom check vs. your last spellcasting check. On a success, they become aware of your magical observation.

spells.name: Sending
spells.description: You send a brief, mental message to any creature with whom you are familiar who is on the same plane.

spells.name: Shapechange
spells.description: You transform yourself and any gear you carry into another natural creature you've seen of level 10 or less. You assume the creature's physical stats and features, but you retain your non-physical stats and features (including INT, WIS, and CHA). If you go to 0 HP while under the effects of this spell, you revert to your true form at 1 HP.

spells.name: Shield of Faith
spells.description: A protective force wrought of your holy conviction surrounds you. You gain a +2 bonus to your armor class for the duration.

spells.name: Silence
spells.description: You magically mute sound in a near cube within the spell’s range. Creatures inside the area are deafened, and any sounds they create cannot be heard.

spells.name: Sleep
spells.description: You weave a lulling spell that fills a near-sized cube extending from you. Living creatures in the area of effect fall into a deep sleep if they are LV 2 or less. Vigorous shaking or being injured wakes them.

spells.name: Smite
spells.description: You call down punishing flames on a creature you can see within range. It takes 1d6 damage.

spells.name: Speak With Dead
spells.description: A dead body you touch answers your questions in a distant, wheezing voice. You can ask the dead body up to three yes or no questions (one at a time). The GM truthfully answers "yes" or "no" to each. If you cast this spell more than once in 24 hours, treat a failed spellcasting check for it as a critical failure instead.

spells.name: Stoneskin
spells.description: Your skin becomes like granite. For the spell's duration, your armor class becomes 17 (20 on a critical spellcasting check).

spells.name: Summon Extraplanar
spells.description: You reach into the outer planes, summoning forth a creature. You summon an elemental or outsider of LV 7 or less. The creature is under your control and acts on your turn. If you lose focus on this spell, you lose control of the creature and it becomes hostile toward you and your allies. You must pass a spellcasting check on your turn to return the creature to the outer planes.

spells.name: Telekinesis
spells.description: You lift a creature or object with your mind. Choose a target that weighs 1,000 pounds or less. You can move it a near distance in any direction and hold it in place.

spells.name: Teleport
spells.description: You and any willing creatures you choose within close range teleport to a location you specify on your same plane. You can travel to a known teleportation sigil or to a location you've been before. Otherwise, you have a 50% chance of arriving off-target.

spells.name: Turn Undead
spells.description: You rebuke undead creatures, forcing them to flee. You must present a holy symbol to cast this spell. Undead creatures within near of you must make a CHA check vs. your spellcasting check. If a creature fails by 10+ points and is equal to or less than your level, it is destroyed. Otherwise, on a fail, it flees from you for 5 rounds.

spells.name: Wall of Force
spells.description: You lift your hands, conjuring a transparent wall of force. The thin wall must be contiguous and can cover a near-sized area in width and length. You choose its shape. Nothing on the same plane can physically pass through the wall.

spells.name: Web
spells.description: You create a near-sized cube of sticky, dense spider web within the spell’s range. A creature stuck in the web can’t move and must succeed on a Strength check vs. your spellcasting check to free itself.

spells.name: Wish
spells.description: This mighty spell alters reality. Make a single wish, stating it as exactly as possible. Your wish occurs, as interpreted by the GM. Treat a failed spellcasting check for this spell as a critical failure, and roll the mishap with disadvantage.

spells.name: Wrath
spells.description: Your weapons become magical +2 and deal an additional d8 damage for the spell's duration.

spells.name: Zone of Truth
spells.description: You compel a creature you can see to speak truth. It can’t utter a deliberate lie while within range.

He wears a white shirt, breeches, and leather apron, and he hauls a towering backpack bursting at the seams. Few know the merchant's true nature and origins, though some theorize he is an immortal being or a god (they are not entirely incorrect). The Wandering Merchant always has something useful, far-flung, or incredible to sell at a reasonable price, and there's no telling when or where he'll show up next...

items.name: Mirror Of Mischief
items.description: A full-length mirror polished to a gleaming shine. Grinning, silver demons grasp the mirror, their claws forming its frame.

traits.name: Curse
traits.description: The first time a humanoid creature looks into this mirror, the mirror creates an evil and malicious duplicate of them. The duplicate can step from the mirror and is an exact copy of the subject (except for magical gear, which looks identical but is mundane in nature). The evil duplicate can live indefinitely outside the mirror. It attempts to sow chaos in the life of the creature it duplicated.

items.name: Moonwrought Chainmail
items.description: A luminous jacket of chainmail as lightweight as a silk shirt.

traits.name: Bonus
traits.description: +1 mithral chainmail.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: Once per day, you can speak the armor's command word. You gain a +1 bonus to your next spellcasting check or ranged attack.

items.name: Necklace Of Charm
items.description: A gold, fishbone chain that shimmers with subtle beauty.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: Your Charisma stat becomes 18 (+4) while wearing this necklace.

items.name: Necrotic Mace Of Withering
items.description: A wrought iron mace tipped with a heavy, screaming skull. Black ichor runs from the skull's eyes when the mace is used to channel necrotic energy.

traits.name: Bonus
traits.description: +1 mace. Can only be wielded by a chaotic priest.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: While holding the mace, you can turn cure wounds spells you cast into harmful magic that instead inflicts the same amount of damage it would heal.

traits.name: Curse
traits.description: If you use the mace to cast an inverted cure wounds spell, you are haunted by nightmares that night. You must pass a DC 12 Wisdom check during your next rest or gain no benefit from resting.

items.name: Nightcloak Armor
items.description: Matte black leathers enchanted to deepen and darken shadows.

traits.name: Bonus
traits.description: +1 leather armor.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: Once per day, you may choose to automatically pass a Dexterity check to hide.

items.name: Obsidian Witchknife
items.description: A glinting, obsidian blade that trails black smoke in thin curls.

traits.name: Bonus
traits.description: +2 dagger. Cannot be wielded by a lawful being.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: When you cast a spell while holding this dagger, you may wound yourself with it. Add the amount of damage you take to your spellcasting check.

items.name: Onyx Destrier
items.description: A polished, ebony statuette of a running horse.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: Once per day, the wielder can speak the command word to turn the statuette into a nightmare that accepts neutral or chaotic riders. The statuette remains in this form for 1 hour.

items.name: Ophidian Armor
items.description: Glistening, smooth leather of dappled emerald scales.

traits.name: Bonus
traits.description: +1 leather armor.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: You have advantage on checks to avoid the effects of poison.

items.name: Pearl Of Power
items.description: A fat, opalescent pearl glowing with an inner radiance.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: Once per day, you may regain the ability to cast a spell you have lost. This cannot restore a spell lost due to a critical spellcasting failure.

items.name: Pipe Of The Rolling Hills
items.description: A long, curved pipe that smells of cloves and resin.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: Up to three times per day, regain 1d4 hit points when you smoke this pipe.

items.name: Pipes Of The Sewers
items.description: A set of tarnished, brass pan pipes with seven cylinders.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: Once per day, you can play these pipes to summon 2d6 giant rats. The rats obey you for d6 rounds, and then they scatter and flee.

traits.name: Curse
traits.description: If you stop playing while the rats are present, they turn on you and attack.

items.name: Portable Hole
items.description: A black, velvet square of cloth that unfolds into a wide circle.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: The Portable Hole folds open on a flat surface into a 6-foot wide, 6-foot deep hole. It has 20 gear slots of storage. The hole closes when you fold the cloth into a small square.

traits.name: Curse
traits.description: Placing this item inside a Bag of Holding or another Portable Hole destroys both items and all held inside them.

items.name: Potion Of Extirpation
items.description: An acrid, tarry substance in an iron flask with a lead stopper.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: You can pour the potion on one object or creature filling up to a close area. The target is utterly removed from reality and cannot be returned by anything short of a wish spell.

traits.name: Personality
traits.description: Chaotic. Protests loudly while being used and never agrees that the target is the right choice for extirpation.

items.name: Potion Of Flying
items.description: A sunny liquid with bubbles that flash and pop like tiny stars.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: You can fly a near distance for 10 rounds when you drink this potion.

items.name: Potion Of Forgetfulness
items.description: A pink draught that swirls with a counter-clockwise current.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: If you serve this potion to an intelligent being and that being drinks it, the imbiber permanently forgets one memory of your choosing.

items.name: Potion Of Giant Strength
items.description: A clay jar holding a stew of green, leafy sludge.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: Your Strength becomes 18 (+4) and you deal x2 damage on melee attacks for 10 rounds.

items.name: Potion Of Healing
items.description: A glass bottle with a fizzy, lemon-vanilla liquid inside.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: The imbiber of this potion regains hit points based on their level. LV 0-3: 1d6 hit points. LV 4-6: 2d8 hit points. LV 7-9: 3d10 hit points. LV 10+: 4d12 hit points.

items.name: Potion Of Invisibility
items.description: This glass vial appears to be empty, but a liquid audibly splashes around inside it.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: When you drink this potion, you become invisible for 10 rounds or until you attack or cast a spell.

items.name: Potion Of Legendary Deeds
items.description: A golden elixir that resonates with a faint, angelic chord.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: When you drink this potion, you gain one level and your XP total resets to zero.

items.name: Potion Of Polymorph
items.description: A pickled newt floats in this lavender flask of clear liquid.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: When you drink this potion, it casts the polymorph spell (pg. 67) on you with a duration of 1 hour instead of 10 rounds.

items.name: Potion Of Vitality
items.description: A crimson elixir that gently thumps with a heartbeat.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: When you drink this potion, roll your class's hit points die. You permanently gain that many HP.

traits.name: Curse
traits.description: If you drink more than one Potion of Vitality in your lifetime, you must pass a DC 18 Constitution check each time or die instantly.

items.name: Ring Of Feather Falling
items.description: A pearly ring carved in the likeness of an owl feather.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: Once per day, the ring can cast feather fall (pg. 60) on you when you fall.

traits.name: Personality
traits.description: Neutral. Fearful of heights. Mentally hoots in an owl-like voice to stay away from the edge of cliffs and pits.

items.name: Ring Of Fireballs
items.description: A bronze loop with claws holding a red marble. A fiery miasma swirls inside the glass.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: You can pluck the glass marble from the ring and throw it up to a far distance, causing a fireball spell (pg. 60) to bloom at the site of impact. The glass marble regrows after you successfully complete a rest.

items.name: Ring Of Invisibility
items.description: A simple, gold band polished to a warm shine.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: Once per day, the ring can cast the invisibility spell (pg. 63) on you.

traits.name: Curse
traits.description: There is a cumulative 1% chance each time you rest that your sleep is ruined by apocalyptic nightmares, and you gain no benefit from resting. This resets to a 1% chance each time it triggers.

items.name: Ring Of Ramlaat
items.description: A bone-carved ring with a ram skull. Its horns twist forward and red lights glow in its eye sockets.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: Once per day, you can enter a rage where you deal double damage for 5 rounds. During the rage, you can't cast spells and enemies have advantage on melee attacks against you.

traits.name: Personality
traits.description: Chaotic. Aggressive, overconfident. Seeks to provoke you and your enemies into battle.

items.name: Robe Of The Archmage
items.description: A red silk robe with a wide, gold- hemmed mantle. Golden eyes and moons dust its sleeves.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: Only a wizard with the Archmage title can wear this robe. Your unarmored AC becomes 15 plus your Dexterity modifier. Choose three spells you know. Their spellcasting DC is always 11. You have advantage on casting the disintegrate spell.

items.name: Robe Of The Druid
items.description: A green velvet robe with a deep hood and hems embroidered with silver leaves and vines.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: Only a wizard with the Druid title can wear this robe. Your unarmored AC becomes 15 plus your Dexterity modifier. Twice per day, you can regain the ability to cast one lost spell. You have advantage on casting the shapechange spell. When you cast it, its duration is 1 hour instead of focus.

items.name: Robe Of The Sorcerer
items.description: A black leather robe with a shadowed cowl and clawed clasps on thin, mithral chains.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: Only a wizard with the Sorcerer title can wear this robe. Your unarmored AC becomes 15 plus your Dexterity modifier. When you cast a spell that deals damage, add your Intelligence modifier to the total. You have advantage on casting the power word kill spell.

items.name: Scarab Of Protection
items.description: A brooch made from a horned scarab beetle dipped in gold.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: If you die, make a DC 18 Constitution check. If you succeed, you are unconscious instead of dead.

items.name: Scimitar Of The Ash Moon
items.description: This wide, curved blade has a snarling efreeti head on the bronze pommel.

traits.name: Bonus
traits.description: +3 greatsword.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: If you roll a critical hit with this weapon, the target is beheaded. It dies instantly if decapitation would kill it.

items.name: Shield Of The Crusader
items.description: A weighty kite shield painted with a faded, crimson cross.

traits.name: Bonus
traits.description: +1 shield. Can only be wielded by a lawful being.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: Once per day, you can speak a prayer to wreathe the shield in holy flames, granting +2 to your AC for 3 rounds.

items.name: Shield Of The Lion
items.description: This shield is carved as a roaring lion's face with a flowing mane.

traits.name: Bonus
traits.description: +1 shield.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: Once per day, you can command the lion to animate and bellow a ferocious roar. All hostile creatures within near range must immediately make a morale check.

items.name: Shortsword Of The Thief
items.description: A stubby, gray blade riddled with notches and scars.

traits.name: Bonus
traits.description: +1 shortsword. +2 if wielded by a halfling or thief.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: Once per day, regain a luck token you just spent.

items.name: Silver Mace Of Wrath
items.description: A tarnished, silver mace with seven flanges in the shape of crescent moons.

traits.name: Bonus
traits.description: +1 mace.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: This weapon deals double damage against creatures with lycanthropy.

items.name: Sphere Of Annihilation
items.description: A three-foot, spherical void of pure darkness that hovers above the ground.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: This sphere utterly destroys all matter it touches. Intelligent beings can move the flying sphere a near distance by passing a DC 18 Intelligence check. If multiple creatures vie for control of the sphere, it is a contested Intelligence check instead. Wizards have advantage on this check. The winner moves the sphere a near distance. If the sphere moves into a space occupied by a creature, the being controlling the sphere makes an attack roll against that creature with a +7 bonus. On a hit, the creature is obliterated.

items.name: Spyglass Of True Sight
items.description: A brass, telescoping lens with magical runes carved on it.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: When you look through the spyglass, you can see invisible creatures and objects.

traits.name: Curse
traits.description: The wielder feels a compulsion to look at everything through the spyglass.

items.name: Staff Of Healing
items.description: A knotted, oak stave with a heavy knurl on one end.

traits.name: Bonus
traits.description: +1 staff.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: Once per day, you can touch a creature with the staff to heal it for 1d6 hit points.

items.name: Staff Of Ord
items.description: A tapered, mithral staff that resonates with arcane power. The tip features an upward- looking eye in a circle of runes.

traits.name: Bonus
traits.description: +3 staff. Can only be wielded by a wizard.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: Functions as a wand of dimension door (pg. 59), fireball (pg. 60), sending (pg. 70), and telekinesis (pg. 72). Unlike a wand, the staff remains intact if you roll a 1 on your spellcasting checks. Hostile spells targeting you are DC 18 to cast.

items.name: Staff Of The Cobra
items.description: A curved scepter tipped with a ruby-eyed, flaring cobra head.

traits.name: Bonus
traits.description: +1 staff.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: All snakes regard you with a friendly attitude unless you do something to upset them. Once per day, you can throw the staff to the ground. It becomes a giant snake for 5 rounds that obeys your mental commands. If the giant snake goes to 0 HP, it reverts into a staff.

traits.name: Curse
traits.description: You have disadvantage on attacks and casting hostile spells targeting snakes.

items.name: Sword Of The Ancients
items.description: A chipped and rusting blade with an oiled leather grip.

traits.name: Bonus
traits.description: +2 longsword.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: The sword is unbreakable and can carve through any material. The owner can summon the sword to their hand if it's on the same plane.

items.name: The Kytherian Mechanism
items.description: A towering, brass platform mounted with countless cogs and gears speckled in blue- green rust.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: A handle turns The Kytherian Mechanism's mighty wheels, but it doesn't function until its seven missing Kytherian Cogs are replaced. Once functional, activating the mechanism allows the operator to undo one event of their choosing from history. Then, the seven Kytherian Cogs magically scatter to far-flung locations.

items.name: The Malediction Infernal
items.description: A black, leatherbound tome with a grinning demon face embossed on the cover.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: A chaotic being who reads this tome gains a level and learns the Diabolic language. A non-chaotic being who reads this book must pass a DC 18 Wisdom check or lose one level. After being read, the tome teleports to a far-flung location.

items.name: Tome Mordanticus
items.description: A hand-drawn bestiary of the multiverse's most notable creatures and people.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: When you read the tome, you learn three True Names (pg. 319) of three beings you choose. Your True Name also appears in the book after reading it.

traits.name: Personality
traits.description: Neutral. Pedantic, fussy. The book constantly tries to escape its owner and can telepathically reach out a near distance to any creature.

items.name: Tome Of Gehemna
items.description: A sturdy, russet volume held by metal clasps. A golden eye in a circle adorns the cover.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: Each day, a random wizard spell scroll appears inside the tome, replacing the spell scroll from the prior day.

traits.name: Personality
traits.description: Neutral. Instructive, technical. Drones on about the obscure points of spellcasting and has an opinion on every wizard's technique.

items.name: Tome Of Hadebe
items.description: A brass-plated book with pages of etched copper leaf.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: The tome contains one each of the following scrolls: burning hands (pg. 56), fireball (pg. 60), and prismatic orb (pg. 67).

items.name: Trident Of The Seas
items.description: A three-pronged, mithral harpoon studded with pearls.

traits.name: Bonus
traits.description: +2 spear.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: You can breathe underwater, as well as speak to and understand wild sea creatures. Once per day, you can cast control water (pg. 57) with a +4 bonus.

items.name: True Name
items.description: The secret, unique name borne by a creature and documented in The Covenant. Few creatures know their own True Names.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: You have advantage on attack rolls and spellcasting checks targeting a creature whose True Name you utter.

items.name: Wand Of Unlife
items.description: The knobby finger-bone of a swamp troll steeped in acrid embalming fluid.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: This wand contains the spells animate dead (pg. 54) and create undead (pg. 58).

traits.name: Curse
traits.description: Each time you use the wand to cast a spell, you take 1d4 points of Constitution damage. If you reach 0 Constitution from this effect, you die and turn into a zombie.

items.name: Wand Of Warding
items.description: A thin, weighty rod of dark iron inscribed with spiraling runes.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: This wand contains the spells dispel magic (pg. 59) and protection from energy (pg. 68).

traits.name: Curse
traits.description: Each time you fail a spellcasting check with this wand, you also lose the ability to cast a random spell you know until you complete a rest.

items.name: War Horn Of The Angels
items.description: An opalescent ox horn capped with a golden mouthpiece.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: Only a lawful being can wield the horn. Once per day, you can blow the horn to cast rebuke unholy (pg. 69) with a +4 bonus. A demon or devil who hears the horn has disadvantage on its Charisma check vs. your rebuke unholy spellcasting check.

items.name: Warhammer Of The Dwarf Lords
items.description: A boxy hammer with a stout handle and leather throwing strap. It hums with a baritone resonance when spun.

traits.name: Bonus
traits.description: +1 warhammer. +2 if wielded by a dwarf.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: This weapon has the thrown property (pg. 37) to a near distance. It always returns to your hand after being thrown. Your attacks with this weapon deal double damage against giants.

items.name: Well Of Many Worlds
items.description: A dark circle of cloth that seems to create a tunnel through the surface it lies upon.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: The Well of Many Worlds folds open on a flat surface into a 6-foot wide hole. Creatures can jump into the hole once per day each to be transported to a random plane of existence.

items.name: Wraith Chain
items.description: A chainmail shirt of black, mithral links that trails a long cloak of writhing shadows.

traits.name: Bonus
traits.description: +1 mithral chainmail.

traits.name: Benefit
traits.description: Once per day, you may cause an attack that hits you to miss instead.
